meanings.definition: The first offspring born to an animal.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was excited to see the firstling of the sheep.
meanings.sent2: The firstling of the litter was a healthy puppy.
meanings.sent3: The firstling of the cow tried to play with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The tiny firstling stood out among its siblings.
meanings.sent5: The firstling's arrival brought joy to the farm.

meanings.definition: The first product or result of a particular process.
meanings.sent1: The baker proudly displayed the firstling of his new recipe.
meanings.sent2: The firstling of the experiment showed promising results.
meanings.sent3: The firstling of the invention surprised everyone with its efficiency.
meanings.sent4: The team celebrated the successful creation of the firstling.
meanings.sent5: The firstling of their collaboration was a breakthrough.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is first in a series.
meanings.sent1: The firstling in the line received a special prize.
meanings.sent2: Being the firstling in the race, she set a new record.
meanings.sent3: The firstling in the queue was eager to enter the amusement park.
meanings.sent4: The firstling of the group led the way with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The firstling of the team always took charge.
